name: Oak Casket
info: A Sinner who is adept at Physical Output. Enters the battle with Ultimate Energy fully charged.
maniaIntensifyText: Deals 10% more Damage, and another 10% more for enemies with broken Cores.
criminalRecord:
Oak Casket is an underground information broker who uses Romanesque Hall as a front. She commits brutal murders, and sells classified information she has collected to violent gangs, which has brought about many large conflicts resulting in heavy casualties; she also disrupts the balance of power in Syndicate by using confidential information to stir up frictions between the various factions in the region.

Several cases of trafficking are also linked to Oak Casket. It's unclear where she obtained the trafficked products (later on, by her own admission, she obtained some of the products herself). This is a serious crime that has disastrous ramifications, she must be detained immediately.

--

For a long time, the subject was active in Syndicate as //the only hall manager who could hold a funeral in Syndicate// and made a living with her ability to obtain information from Corruptor remains. But judging from her behavior after her arrest, she seems to have long tired of life around gangsters and looks forward to a change.

Currently, the subject's conduct in the Bureau is satisfactory. Although she still has an avid interest in death and remains, her obsession is overall still under control.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Oak Casket's power allows her to capture and decode the information that is carried in the electric field and magnetic field created by a newly-dead Maniac's brain and body. How much information she can attain is inversely proportionate to how long the person has been dead.

+++* Awakening Signs
Oak Casket was infected with Mania and awakened her power in a mass grave somewhere in Syndicate when she was a teenager; she was badly injured, but miraculously survived. As a Sinner, she has the ability to heal her body to a certain degree without any external help, and to attain useful information from newly-dead Maniacs.

+++* Corruption State
The test results show that Oak Casket suffers from a moderate level of Maniac corruption. No abnormalities have been found on her body, but when her mind is exposed to certain types of stimulation, she will hallucinate and exhibit other symptoms.
ecbFlavourText:
"Only when a person has lost their vitality, their foolishness, dullness, and vileness... can be redeemed."
"Perhaps the same goes for this city."
arrestRec1: The Chief meets Oak Casket in Syndicate during a rescue mission. The Chief first clashes with and then works with her, and at the end of tthe mission, she goes to the MBCC with the Chief of her own volition, and agrees to be detained.
arrestRec2: Born during the most chaotic period in Syndicate, the subject was adopted by a kind soul at a rescue station and lived with several other children. This rescue station was the precursor to the Romanesque Hall. During this time, because of her introverted personality, she was regarded as an oddity by those around her.
arrestRec3: At the age of thirteen or fourteen, the rescue station was besieged due to the involvement in gang-related incidents, and the subject was seriously injured in the assault. Barely clinging to life, she was abandoned by her benefactor. From then on, she awakened as a Sinner.
arrestRec4: Investigations reveal that after being abandoned, the subject became disillusioned with the chaotic situation in Syndicate, believing that there was no hope in the world. After resolving her obsessions with the Chief, her perspective somewhat changed, and she held a funeral for her past self.
servingTerm1: In the early days of her detention, Oak Casket is passive and cold, with vital signs once being abnormally low. She is then diagnosed with //information input disruption syndrome//, which manifests itself as a passiveness arising from an inability to adjust to a normal environment after a long period of residing in an abnormal environment.
servingTerm2: After a period of adjustment, Oak Casket starts getting accustomed to her life in detention. She is still passive and cold, and is not performing as well as she should be in battles, but has a tremendous fighting spirit. The MBCC later decides to let Chief include her in as many battles as possible, so as to satisfy her need of extracting information from the newly dead.
servingTerm3: To further alleviate Oak Casket's passiveness, the MBCC agrees to move her to the room next to Dudu's, and replace the bed in the room with a long, black oak casket. She is doing well at the moment, on the road to recovery, and starts to get along with the other Sinners.
servingTerm4: Oak Casket's symptoms have been improving thanks to the comforting of Chief and Dudu, and she is returning to the physical status she was back in Syndicate. She is becoming more trusting of Chief, and more willingly to protect Chief in battles; she is not as obsessed as before with seeing those around her dead so that she can extract information from them.
emotionCheck1:
[Oak Casket is lying in a long black box in her room, with a peaceful face.]

**Oak Casket:** Want to join me for awhile? There's plenty of room to spare.

**Chief:** â€¦â€¦

* **Prompt:** ...Okay.
 * **Oak Casket:** How about it? Do you feel a different kind of peace?
 * **Oak Casket:** ğŸ˜

* **Prompt:** No, but thanks.
 * **Oak Casket:** Are you uncomfortable because it's too hard? I can get you some soft cushions.
 * **Oak Casket:** ğŸ˜¦

[Oak Casket is making a small brown box with a tool]

**Oak Casket:** Hmm... Sure enough, cypress wood is more suitable.

**Chief:** â€¦â€¦

* **Prompt:** What are you making?
* **Oak Casket:** Guess what? It was commissioned by someone for her dead pet parrot.

 * **Oak Casket:** ğŸ˜
supervision1:
++* âš  Cool Off

//Oak Casket's popularity in the MBCC seems to positively correlate with the temperature.//

**System Notifications:** During the dog days of summer, everyone likes to go and have a chat with Oak Casket. They leave covered in hot sweat and return covered in cold sweat. Nothing helps cool things off better.

* **Prompt:** Really?

**System Notifications:** You plan to verify this rumor yourself later today.
supervision2:
++* âš  Reap Without Sowing

//Dudu drags Oak Casket to run a booth with her in the Outdoor Activity Area.//

**System Notifications:** Dudu drags Oak Casket to run a booth with her in the Bureau, providing one-stop funeral services. But only Dudu works busily hustling for customers. Oak Casket sits on the side reading a literary anthology placidly the whole time.

* **Prompt:** This kind of activity is forbidden in the MBCC!
supervision3:
++* âš âš  Butterfly Specimen

//Oak Casket concentrates on making a new butterfly specimen.//

**System Notifications:** Oak Casket concentrates on making a new butterfly specimen. Those rare, beautiful blue wings easily grab your attention.

**Oak Casket:** Blue morphos are rare, I didn't think I'd find them in the Bureau.

**Oak Casket:** Come closer to take a better look.

**Chief:** Um, okay.

**Chief:** ...

**Chief:** You seem to be into specimen-making?

**Oak Casket:** Yes.

**Oak Casket:** It attains its ultimate form when it's turned into a specimen.

* **Prompt:** Why?

**Oak Casket:** In this world, all beauty eventually perishes with time, but I've preserved the peak of its beauty eternally. It's a holy thing, don't you think?
supervision4:
++* âš âš  Outland Literary Anthology

//Oak Casket flips through a book with a cover written in Outland language in the library.//

**System Notifications:** Oak Casket flips through a book with a cover written in Outland language in the library. You seldom see her here, so you go up to her out of curiosity.

**Chief:** Oak Casket, what are you reading?

**Oak Casket:** A literary anthology.

* **Prompt:** You know Outland language?

**Oak Casket:** No, but I've learned this eulogy in the Romanesque Hall. That's why I can read it.

**System Notifications:** She reads a line to you in Outland language.

* **Prompt:** Ask the meaning

**Chief:** What does that mean?

**Oak Casket:** The rough translation is like this... Please grant him the perfect rest. May the holy spirit be bathed in eternal light.

**Chief:** It's beautiful. Thanks for explaining it to me.

**System Notifications:** Hearing your response, she chuckles and lifts the corner of her mouth playfully.

**Oak Casket:** Not at all. When the day comes that you really need a recitation of this, I'll read it for you again.

**Chief:** ...Ahem.

**Chief:** I hope that day never comes.
supervision5:
++* âš âš âš  Perfume

//Whenever you pass by Oak Casket, you can always smell a very special fragrance.//

**System Notifications:** Whenever you pass by Oak Casket or her room, you can always smell a very special fragrance.

* **Prompt:** Ask

**Chief:** Oak Casket, do you wear perfume? It's a very special scent.

**Oak Casket:** This is not perfume, it's vetiver fragrance.

**Oak Casket:** If you like it, I can give you some.

**Chief:** Oh, thank you.

**Chief:** Why do you like this fragrance, by the way?

**Oak Casket:** Vetiver has a warm scent of deep soil and an excellent relaxing property. Use it on your body, and you'll feel comforted and a sense of belonging of returning to the earth.

**Chief:** I see...

**Oak Casket:** Of course, this fragrance has an even more important use. It masks odor very well.

* **Prompt:** Mask odor?
 * **Oak Casket:** It can mask... um... the smell of decay. Do you get what I mean?
 * **Oak Casket:** Do I need to put it more plainly?
 * **System Notifications:** Finally realizing what odor she's implying, you break out in a cold sweat and quickly wave your hands.
 * **Chief:** No need! You've explained it clearly enough!

* **Prompt:** I think I know what odor you're trying to mask...
 * **Chief:** No need to go into the details!
 * **System Notifications:** Realizing what odor she's implying, you break out in a cold sweat and quickly wave your hands while she only regards you with amusement.
 * **Oak Casket:** You're smart. No wonder you're the MBCC's Chief.
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  The Story of a Necklace

//Oak Casket carries a locket with her everywhere. Chief is curious about it.//

**System Notifications:** Oak Casket carries a locket with her everywhere. You've seen the photo inside. It's one of an unknown woman and a boy. You wonder how these two people are related to Oak Casket.

* **Prompt:** Ask

**Chief:** Oak Casket, can I ask you a question?

**Oak Casket:** Sure, ask away.

**Chief:** Whose photo is it in your locket?

**Oak Casket:** Oh, you mean this. This necklace doesn't belong to me.

**Chief:** Hmm? It's not yours?

**Oak Casket:** It belonged to that woman in the photo. She passed away a long time ago.

**Oak Casket:** That old lady was very ill at the time, but she just wouldn't let go of it. Before she passed away, she wanted to know if her son, who left home after a fight with her, did forgive her in the end.

**Oak Casket:** In fact, her son didn't run away from home. He died in a car accident the night the fight happened, but the old lady's family never told her for fear that she couldn't take the bad news.

**Oak Casket:** So I told her the truth.

**Oak Casket:** Do you think I did something wrong?

* **Prompt:** It's wrong
 * **Chief:** On her deathbed, she probably just wanted to hear some comforting words that would make her departure easier.
 * **Oak Casket:** ...I see.

* **Prompt:** It's not wrong
 * **Chief:** False hope and consolation are meaningless. I think what she needed to know was the truth.
 * **Oak Casket:** You think so? How surprising.
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
I'd rather chat with you in the cemetery than in the interrogation room.. you lie inside while I sit outside. I think our chat will be much better that way.

[Raise to Phase 1]
Shhh... I hear their whispers.

[Raise to Phase 3]
Want to join... our tea party?

[Level Start]
Did you hear the bell tolling? The ceremoney is about to begin.

[Win Battles]
Don't worry, the elegy is already playing.

[Lose Battles]
It's okay, it's not time for eternal sleep yet.

[Ultimate Skill]
Rest for eternity!

[Die in Battles]
Everyone... eventually ends up in an oaken casket...

[Greeting]
Hello Chief. Let us both celebrate and mourn the fact that we are still alive today.

[Conversation 1]
If you need a band... go find a musician named Dudu. Mention my name and maybe she'll give you a discount.

[Conversation 2]
Syndicate needed a grand farewell to usher in another perfect rebirth.

[Conversation 3]
Rest beneath the ground, glide with the wind, or drift along the tide? It doesn't really matter, my friend. They are just one necessary step to salvation.

[Special Conversation 1]
Those who're inside caskets do not pine for the weeping of mourners. Their tears will only wash away the last of their traces and drown out their cries.

[Special Conversation 2]
Only when there is an eternity of silence, the stupidity, boredom, and vileness of life will be changed into something intriguing... However, there is something different about you.

[Special Conversation 3]
I cannot personally preside over my own funeral, but I will leave you my last word. Will you accept it?

[Full Compliance]
You intrigue me more than the dead. Please forgive me for burdening you with my darkness, loneliness, and desperation... Even upon death, I will stay by your side.

[Idle]
Pray? I don't do such... useless things.

[Annoyed]
Do you like me this much? Too bad I can't blow fragile bubbles inside my skull.

[Special Attention]
What do you see through my eyes?

[Dispatch]
Want to go for a walk in the cemetery with me?

[Dispatch Complete]
Hmm, yes... I heard a lot of little secrets.

[Level Up]
I can tell that you really need me.
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Since the moment you stepped into the forest, you've belonged to me. I shall grant you eternal slumber. As for me, I will get everything I want.

[Greeting]
Good, come and eat the fruit I offer you... You'll receive the sweetest salvation.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
Someonce once presented me with a magic mirror that speaks only the truth. Guess whose existence I discovered from its mouth?

[Ordinary Contact 2]
I'm not the ruler of this place. I simply provide lost travelers with a place to rest forever.

[Ordinary Contact 3]
Snow covers tracks, apples arouse desires, and ebony safeguards secrets... What do you wish to decorate your resting place with?

[Ordinary Contact 4]
Close your eyes, and you shall see the boundless darkness of the forbidden forest... But fear not. Give me your hand, and I shall take you to where you ought to be.

[Idle] 
This forest is not silent. After all, they have been talking to me from six feet under.

[Special Attention] 
Since you're so curious about me... stay and become part of my collection.

[Level Up}
I shall give you riper fruit.

[Pat Head]
The rainbow has seven colors, and God created the world in seven days. The seven gems on my crown allow me to hear discarnate whispers. If that's also what you want... come and try to snatch my crown.
nightmareTalent: For each battle won, all allied Sinners gain a 1.5% Energy Recovery boost. The boost is capped at 15%.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Black Mass
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: New Exclusive Ultimate [Silent Finale]. Oak Casket switches her fighting strategy, sacrificing some of her Attack Speed to expand her Normal Attack range to cover the whole field. At the same time, the damage of her Normal Attack is increased by 170%/195%/220%. In this state, Oak Casket spends 3 points of Energy per second and no longer recovers Energy over time. She will exit this state upon receiving control effects or performing actions other than Normal Attacks. [Silent Finale] has a cooldown time of 15 seconds after each use.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText:
"Only when a person has lost their vitality, their foolishness, dullness, and vileness... can be redeemed."
"Perhaps the same goes for this city."

maniaIntensify.title: Conquer the Enemey
maniaIntensify.text: Deals 10% more damage, and another 10% more for enemies with broken Cores.

crimebrandSets.name: Main set
crimebrandSets.note: The main crimebrand set for Oak. Make sure she is out of range when Normal Attacking.

crimebrandSets.name: Alternative for ulting
crimebrandSets.note: Increases her ultimate damage for 5 seconds after she Normal Attacks 15 times.

crimebrandSets.name: Very Cheap Alternative
crimebrandSets.note: Can be used if you have nothing else.

shackles.title: Hymn in the Box
shackles.description: Oak Casket's damage increases by 25%. The effect stops when she takes any damage and resumes when she doesn't take any damage within 10 seconds.

shackles.title: Whispers of Thousand Hills
shackles.description: "Secret Language's" cooldown is reduced to 12 seconds.

skills.name: Ebony/Ivory
skills.description: Oak Casket attacks with double guns, dealing (Attack * 30%) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Funeral Elegy
skills.description: Oak Casket moves to the target grid and attacks all enemies within range, dealing (Attack *320%) Physical Damage in total. "Funeral Elegy" can charge up to 3 times.

skills.name: Psionic Lament
skills.description: For every Energy point Oak Casket has, her damage will be increased by 1.8%.

skills.name: Secret Language
skills.description: Every 15 seconds, the damage of Oak Casket's next Normal Attack increases by 105% and regains 6 points of Energy.

upgrade.description: Damage increases by $0%. Restores $0 points of Energy.

compliance: Unlock information: Surveillance records to unlock emoticons
Unlock Information: Surveillance Records, Unlock Voice: Obedience Level Up, Unlock Title: Life Slit

voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - EN: Snow covers tracks, apples arouse desires, and ebony safeguards secrets... What do you wish to decorate your resting place with?

voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - EN: Close your eyes, and you shall see the boundless darkness of the forbidden forest... But fear not. Give me your hand, and I shall take you to where you ought to be.
